body: set_cc${1}0=89 label_cc${1}0=Ambience Size     // Room size (variable from 'cardboard box' through 'vocal booth' to 'medium studio')
set_cc${1}1=89 label_cc${1}1=Ambience HF Damp  // Gentle low-pass filter to emulate the high frequency absorption of softer wall surfaces
set_cc${1}2=114 label_cc${1}2=Ambience Mix     // Wet/dry mix (affects perceived distance)
MDA Ambience Effect Setup.description: MDA Ambience effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=127 label_cc${1}0=Bandisto Listen    // Audition the low, mid and high bands individually
set_cc${1}1=51 label_cc${1}1=Bandisto L/M        // Low/mid crossover frequency
set_cc${1}2=64 label_cc${1}2=Bandisto M/H        // Mid/high crossover frequency
set_cc${1}3=64 label_cc${1}3=Bandisto Low Dist   // Low band distortion amount
set_cc${1}4=64 label_cc${1}4=Bandisto Mid Dist   // Mid band distortion amount
set_cc${1}5=64 label_cc${1}5=Bandisto High Dist  // High band distortion amount
set_cc${1}6=64 label_cc${1}6=Bandisto Low Out    // Low band output level trim
set_cc${1}7=64 label_cc${1}7=Bandisto Mid Out    // Mid band output level trim
set_cc${1}8=64 label_cc${1}8=Bandisto High Out   // High band output level trim
set_cc${1}9=51 label_cc${1}9=Bandisto Mode       // Transistor/valve; set clipping to Bipolar (top and bottom of waveform) or Unipolar (just tops)
MDA Bandisto Effect Setup.description: MDA Bandisto effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=127 label_cc${1}0=Combo Model    // DI (flat frequency response); Tradtional speaker simulator; Small radio speaker; Small combo (close mic); Small combo (far mic); Large stack (mic in front); Large stack (mic from side, scooped out mid EQ)
set_cc${1}1=64 label_cc${1}1=Combo Drive     // Amount of clipping (turn to left for soft, right for hard)
set_cc${1}2=64 label_cc${1}2=Combo Bias      // Clip one side of the waveform more than the other for rougher or 'gated' effects (use an oscilloscope plug-in to see what's happening)
set_cc${1}4=51 label_cc${1}4=Combo Process   // Defaults to Mono to reduce processor usage, even in a stereo channel
set_cc${1}5=0 label_cc${1}5=Combo HPF Freq   // Wet/dry mix
set_cc${1}6=64 label_cc${1}6=Combo HPF Reso  // Level trim
MDA Combo Effect Setup.description: MDA Combo effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=102 label_cc${1}0=Degrade Headroom      // Peak clipping threshold
set_cc${1}1=64 label_cc${1}1=Degrade Quant          // Bit depth (typically 8 or below for 'telephone' quality)
set_cc${1}2=83 label_cc${1}2=Degrade Rate           // Sample Rate (turn control to left or right for different sound characters)
set_cc${1}3=114 label_cc${1}3=Degrade Post Filter   // Low-pass filter to muffle the distortion produced by the previous two controls
set_cc${1}4=74 label_cc${1}4=Degrade Non-Linearity  // Additional harmonic distortion 'thickening' (turn control to left or right for different sound characters)
MDA Degrade Effect Setup.description: MDA Degrade effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=64 label_cc${1}0=Delay Freq      // Left channel delay time
set_cc${1}1=34 label_cc${1}1=Delay Fine      // Right channel delay as a percentage of left channel delay - variable to left, fixed ratios to right
set_cc${1}2=89 label_cc${1}2=Delay Feedback  // Feedback (sum of left and right outputs)
set_cc${1}3=64 label_cc${1}3=Delay FB Tone   // Feedback filtering - low-pass to left, high-pass to right
set_cc${1}4=42 label_cc${1}4=Delay Wet Mix   // Wet mix
MDA Delay Effect Setup.description: MDA Delay effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=25 label_cc${1}0=Detune          // Detune amount in cents (left channel is lowered in pitch, right channel is raised)
set_cc${1}3=64 label_cc${1}3=Detune Latency  // Trade-off between latency and low-frequency response
MDA Detune Effect Setup.description: MDA Detune effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=64 label_cc${1}0=Dither Bits     // Output word length 8-24 bits

set_cc${1}1=112 label_cc${1}1=Dither Type    // OFF (Truncation), TRI (Triangular PDF dither), HP-TRI (High-pass Triangular PDF dither (a good general purpose dither)), N-SHAPE (Second-order noise-shaped dither (for final mastering to 8 or 16 bits))

set_cc${1}2=64 label_cc${1}2=Dither Amp      // Dither amplitude; is at optimum level but can be turned down to reduce background hiss at the expense of dither level 'pumping' caused by the input signal type and level
set_cc${1}3=64 label_cc${1}3=Dither DC Trim  // Fine tune DC offset; can help get best dither sound for silent or very quiet inputs

set_cc${1}4=0 label_cc${1}4=Dither Zoom      // Allows the signal to be faded into the noise floor at a clearly audible level so dither settings can be 'auditioned'. Note that some (perceptual) properties of dither will change when listened to in this way
MDA Dither Effect Setup.description: MDA Dither effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=38 label_cc${1}0=DubDelay Delay      // Delay time (delay is mono for authenticity!)
set_cc${1}1=89 label_cc${1}1=DubDelay Feedback   // Feedback - with soft saturation at maximum left position, hard clipping at maximum right
set_cc${1}2=51 label_cc${1}2=DubDelay FB Tone    // Feedback filtering - low-pass to left, high-pass to right
set_cc${1}3=0 label_cc${1}3=DubDelay LFO Depth   // Delay time modulation (sine wave)
set_cc${1}4=64 label_cc${1}4=DubDelay LFO Rate   // Modulation rate
set_cc${1}5=42 label_cc${1}5=DubDelay FX Miz     // Wet/dry mix
MDA DubDelay Effect Setup.description: MDA DubDelay effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=84 label_cc${1}0=Les Speed        // Rotor speed: Stop/Slow/Fast
set_cc${1}2=61 label_cc${1}2=Les X-Over Freq  // Crossover frequency between high and low rotors
set_cc${1}3=89 label_cc${1}3=Les Hi Width     // High rotor pan modulation
set_cc${1}4=76 label_cc${1}4=Les Hi Depth     // High rotor frequency modulation (doppler)
set_cc${1}5=89 label_cc${1}5=Les Hi Throb     // High rotor amplitude modulation
set_cc${1}6=64 label_cc${1}6=Les Lo Width     // Low rotor pan modulation
set_cc${1}7=64 label_cc${1}7=Les Fine Speed   // Fine control for rotor speed
set_cc${1}8=76 label_cc${1}8=Les Lo Throb     // Low rotor amplitude modulation
MDA Leslie Effect Setup.description: MDA Leslie effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}4=64 label_cc${1}4=Limiter Knee     // Hard or soft knee
MDA Limiter Effect Setup.description: MDA Limiter effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=0 label_cc${1}0=Overdrive Drive    // Amount of distortion
set_cc${1}1=0 label_cc${1}1=Overdrive Muffle   // Gentle low-pass filter
MDA Overdrive Effect Setup.description: MDA Overdrive effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}3=108 label_cc${1}3=RezFilter Env>VCF  // Positive or negative (squelchy!) Envelope modulation of cut-off frequency
set_cc${1}4=0 label_cc${1}4=RezFilter Attack     // (use fast attack and release for 'dirty' modulation)
set_cc${1}5=64 label_cc${1}5=RezFilter Release   // (use fast attack and release for 'dirty' modulation)
set_cc${1}6=89 label_cc${1}6=RezFilter LFO>VCF   // LFO modulation of cut-off frequency (turn to left for sample & hold LFO, right for sine)
set_cc${1}7=51 label_cc${1}7=RezFilter LFO Rate  // LFO modulation speed
set_cc${1}8=0 label_cc${1}8=RezFilter Trigger    // Envelope trigger level (normally set to minimum to acts as a free-running envelope follower)
set_cc${1}9=95 label_cc${1}9=RezFilter Max Freq  // Limit maximum cut-off frequency for a mellower sound (the filter can sound 'screechy' at high frequencies)
MDA RezFilter Effect Setup.description: MDA RezFilter effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=8 label_cc${1}0=RingMod Freq      // Set oscillator frequency in 100Hz steps; 8=1kHz
set_cc${1}1=0 label_cc${1}1=RingMod Fine      // Oscillator frequency fine tune
set_cc${1}2=0 label_cc${1}2=RingMod Feedback  // Amount of feedback for 'harsh' sound
MDA RingMod Effect Setup.description: MDA RingMod effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.

body: set_cc${1}0=0 label_cc${1}0=SubSynth Type       // Distort: Takes the existing low frequencies, clips them to produce harmonics at a constant level, then filters out the higher harmonics. Has a similar effect to compressing the low frequencies.
// Divide: As above, but works at an octave below the input frequency, like an octave divider guitar pedal.
// Invert: Flips the phase of the low frequency signal once per cycle to add a smooth sub-octave. A simplified version of the classic Sub-Harmonic Synthesizer.
// Key Osc: Adds a decaying 'boom'; usually made with an oscillator before a noise gate keyed with the kick drum signal.
set_cc${1}1=38 label_cc${1}1=SubSynth Level     // Amount of synthesized low frequencysignal to be added
set_cc${1}2=76 label_cc${1}2=SubSynth Tune      // Maximum frequency - keep as low as possible to reduce distortion. In Key Osc mode sets the oscillator frequency
set_cc${1}3=127 label_cc${1}3=SubSynth Dry Mix  // Reduces the level of the original signal
set_cc${1}4=76 label_cc${1}4=SubSynth Thresh    // Increase to 'gate' the low frequency effect and stop unwanted background rumbling
set_cc${1}5=83 label_cc${1}5=SubSynth Release   // Decay time in Key Osc mode
MDA SubSynth Effect Setup.description: MDA SubSynth effect setup including <control> and <effect> blocks.
